content: Family Savings Asked by Poh Wen JieAsked on 24 Aug 2019What are some strategies to increase parents' savings?My parents are coming to their 70s. They have started their CPF Life payout and Retirement Sum Scheme respectively. They earn about $600/month from their part-time job. Their cash savings are not a lot, less than $15K for each person. They are healthy currently.What are strategies and steps that could be taken to increase their savings so that they have enough for basic necessities such as food, transport, bills etc? And also sufficient funds for their funeral expenses?1 answerAnswerBump2

God of WisdomUpdated on 24 Aug 2019Do check if they have any existing life insurance policies. That might be a place that have cash value or a means to pay for funeral expenses.Another way is for you to give them more allowance and possibly top up their CPF accounts.Lastly, if they're already making $600/mth, I think that's great. If they have the time, energy, and opportunity to find more income, it'll be an option, but if not, I think that $600 is already pretty decent.You should be the one giving them another stream of income through allowance. :)0 comments4
